intro: Pycreus pannonicus, commonly known as the Pannonian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and river valleys, preferring well-drained soils. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it blooms from late spring to early summer. Pycreus pannonicus is valued for its ornamental beauty and ecological importance in supporting pollinators.
